snippet: Rasheed Wallace’s “Ball Don’t Lie” catchphrase suggests that the ball is the ultimate arbiter of on-court justice, but recently those words have mostly meant punishment for him.
abstract: New York Knicks forward Rasheed Wallace often uses catchphrase 'ball don't lie!' as retort against what he perceives as unfairness, but repeatedly shouting during game against Phoenix Suns inevitably led his ejection; Wallace has been assessed 317 technical fouls, most in NBA history.
lead_paragraph: Rasheed Wallace’s “Ball Don’t Lie” catchphrase suggests that the ball is the ultimate arbiter of on-court justice, but recently those words have mostly meant punishment for him.

headline.seo: Rasheed Wallace Keeps Technicals Flowing With ‘Ball Don’t Lie’
headline.main: With ‘Ball Don’t Lie,’ Wallace Keeps Technicals Flowing
